title: 5 injured in NW Atlanta shootout
content:
ATLANTA (CBS46) -
Five people were injured Saturday afternoon in what neighbors described as a shootout in northwest Atlanta.
CBS46 was first on the scene.
Authorities responded to the 2900 block of Delmar Lane after security at the location asked police for help with the shooting, according to a spokesperson with Atlanta police.
Five people were shot and two of the victims fled the scene.
"We have found shell casings in an isolated location here on scene, but it's hard to say whether these individuals were shooting at each other, whether they were fired upon. Still in the very early stages of the investigation," said Officer Ralph Woolfolk with Atlanta police.
All five victims were eventually taken to the hospital with one person in critical condition, according to police.
A spokesperson with Atlanta police said late Saturday that one of the victims was treated and released from the hospital.
Police said at least 50 bullets were fired. Neighbors told CBS46's Dontaye Carter that they rushed to make sure their children were on the ground when the shooting started.
"I'm just glad me or my kids weren't one of those statistics. Like I said, it's dangerous and its kids getting shot, you know kids killing kids and it's shouldn't even be like that," said a woman who asked to be called Chyna.
The victims are expected to make a full recovery.
No one is in custody at this time.
